content.question: The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 10 to the power of 0.8 x plus 2.4 end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mn>0.8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2.4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is graphed on a semi-log plot, where the <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-axis is a logarithmic base <math alttext="10"><semantics><mn>10</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> scale. On the semi-log plot, the graph of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is a line. The graph of the function <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is also a line on the same semi-log plot. The slope of the graph of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the same as the slope of the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-intercept of the graph of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 0 comma k close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. However, the <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-intercept of the graph of <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 0 comma 1 half k close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Of the following, which value is closest to <math alttext="g open parentheses 2 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mn>2</mn></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
